routes.name: CATHARSIS CORNER
routes.description: Start at the right of the biggest corner on the cliff to the right of the tree.Move up 6m, then right, go up and left to rejoin the corner. Go left below the overhang and move up gently on loose blocks. Place peg to the right and move up on to a small platform. Pull up on a block (gently!) and then move right. Continue up a blocky pillar to a small platform. Above is a shallow gully with loose rock walls on either side and much grass and ivy in the middle. Place a peg here. It is possible to place two small nuts in the next 2m. Move up into the gully and then left. Exit carefully.

routes.name: CARLA'S CORNER
routes.description: The corner at the left end of the crag. Climb the short corner on the left, moving right at the flake. Continue to tree. Climb corner on left past overhangs with surprisingly good protection. Abseil off tree or scramble up left to make a long descent left. ROUTE WITH A VIEW 48m HVS 5b, 3c Start - in the corner right of Carla's Corner. 1) Climb the corner using excellent crack to overhang. Hand traverse right to reach sloping ledge (crux). 2) Traverse ledge to tree on arête. Move right past two more trees to top. Abseil off. WIDE LEGGED AND FOOTLESS 44m HVS 5a The big corner right of Route With A View. Start left of a tree. Climb to overhang and swing left to ledge (crux). Continue to a ledge under second over-hang. Pass blocks and continue up groove and corner on right. A FIERCE PANCAKE 25m VS 4b Start 25m right of Route With A View below a shallow corner. Follow cleaned rock to a wide top crack.

routes.description: Start 25m right of Route With A View below a shallow corner. Follow cleaned rock to a wide top crack.

routes.name: PIN HOLES
routes.description: Climbs the wall just left of the boulder-choked gully which forms the descent. (No protection) PIN HEAD ARÊTE 15m VD Climbs the arête right of chimney which splits the north face of The Pin. MIDGE SLAB 10m D Climbs the slab to the right of Pin Head. (No protection) Soñar E6 6a 30m *** A. Marshall, P. Swail A surprisingly unrelenting route with many surprises. It takes the left of the 2 obvious aretes above the boulder field right of the green mesh walk in to culcagh mountain. A hard committing and unprotected start (crux) leaves you at the first horizontal break with good gear. From here proceed up the face and arete until left at a slot high on the wall move up and out right to the arete and onto the other side. From a good flat hold move up and left to a comfortable position below the final piece of the arete. Beware of the small friable holds at this point. Gaining the jug above this leaves a short trip up some wobbly blocks to the top. Pads protected the start. The Easy VS 10m Just right of the stairs (N0.1), an above the 1st boulder field, In the corner about 50m over just below a clean flat slab of rock. A Horizontal Crack, start on the ledge below, jamming mostly the whole way to the top, Cams are a benefit on the climb. Two Finger & Toe E1 6b 27m Just in the middle crag (N0.2) as you will see on the approach. Stepping out unto a nearly detached pillar like from the Top being cellarful(a Traverse line for safety may be helpful, From Boulder). Abseil down the left side to the bottom, Plenty to construct a anchor her including a piton. Here you find the start of the climb. A large crack running quarter way up, with a flake to the right. Near top of this crack ,step out to your left, don't pull to hard on the loose boulder/s sitting on top of each other. Stepping up onto the boulders, an take a few boulder problem moves to grip the spike like rock to pull up brings you to a few more boulder like problems. The next 1.5 m is the hardest part, with little to no real holds, with some good gear placements available gives you boost, an top out nicely. The Slab D 5m Small slab like climb (N0.4), with good two way jamming crack running the whole way up, makes a nice easy climb. This part of the crag is found around 50m past the outstanding biggest east facing Buttress that you will notice on approach. Two Pitons Lie on rock Behind the climb. Midget Crack HS 4c 27m (On N0.5) The on the right hand crack as your at the bottom looking at the cliff. Another 50m there about past the slab route(N0.4 Crag Area).You will spot the unstable looking boulder across the way! Good Gear Placements the whole way up.3/4 way up step out to right up the grass corner(Some Lose Rock May be here, an top out. Before the Step out to the grass ledge, Its possible to continue straight up the crack to top out at a (HVS). Mighty Crack Up E2 5c ? (Yet to be Cleanly Climbed) Across the way below the Unstable looking boulder at the top ,lies beneath a large crack straight to the top, narrowing towards the top. Large cams is a must for the bottom part of the climb. Big body jamming crack, slightly overhanging half way up.

routes.name: B.L.M.
routes.description: YOUTHFUL OUTING S 4a This climb follows a small corner to the left of Tisakracker on a series of small holds onto large dirty ledges left of small tree. Climb directly to top through trees. TISAKRACKER 25m VS 4b On the left of valley near a steep broken gully. Climb the clean jamming crack in corner left of gully. ROOTS 20m D Climbs the tree filled gully on the right of the Aiguille. BRUTE FORCE 20m VS 4b Start between Tisakracker and Third Force. Climb the obvious steep crack at flake edge. Ending in jungle. THIRD FORCE 25m HVS 5a Start - left-slanting corner right of Tisakraker. Climb corner and hand jam overhang to a small tree and ledge. Fight wall and bushes to top. POINTLESS ALTERNATIVE 25m VS 4c Climb Auntyclimbx as far as the large tree. Traverse onto tree then traverse left again on small exposed holds and go for the small branch sticking out of large crack at the top of Third Force, continue through trees to top. AUNTYCLIMBX 25m VS 4c Start - a faint corner below large tree at half height right of Third Force. Chimney up corner and step left to climb crack and hug big tree. Up chimney to top. MARK'S ROUTE 22m VS 4c This route is on the undercut buttress with groove from half height. Start in next corner right of Auntyclimbx. Climb corner until it is possible to traverse right into groove which is climbed to the top. TASK FORCE 25m VS 4c The corner 5m right of Third Force. Climb the loosish left-hand corner to a large ledge. Continue up the wide right-hand crack. The crux is at a chockstone. Delicate bridging above. GUNGE 20m VD 30 m right of Task Force, at an obvious stepped diagonal line leading rightwards. Start about 2m right of 'Arête' in a little corner. Move up and rightwards to a steep section below a block. Pull up and continue up the little rock steps. Move left and up past tree at the top. Good climbing.

Move up and rightwards to a steep section below a block. Pull up and continue up the little rock steps. Move left and up past tree at the top. Good climbing.

routes.name: THIRD FORCE
routes.description: Start - left-slanting corner right of Tisakraker. Climb corner and hand jam overhang to a small tree and ledge. Fight wall and bushes to top. POINTLESS ALTERNATIVE 25m VS 4c Climb Auntyclimbx as far as the large tree. Traverse onto tree then traverse left again on small exposed holds and go for the small branch sticking out of large crack at the top of Third Force, continue through trees to top. AUNTYCLIMBX 25m VS 4c Start - a faint corner below large tree at half height right of Third Force. Chimney up corner and step left to climb crack and hug big tree. Up chimney to top. MARK'S ROUTE 22m VS 4c This route is on the undercut buttress with groove from half height. Start in next corner right of Auntyclimbx. Climb corner until it is possible to traverse right into groove which is climbed to the top. TASK FORCE 25m VS 4c The corner 5m right of Third Force. Climb the loosish left-hand corner to a large ledge. Continue up the wide right-hand crack. The crux is at a chockstone. Delicate bridging above. GUNGE 20m VD 30 m right of Task Force, at an obvious stepped diagonal line leading rightwards. Start about 2m right of 'Arête' in a little corner. Move up and rightwards to a steep section below a block. Pull up and continue up the little rock steps. Move left and up past tree at the top. Good climbing.

routes.name: POINTLESS ALTERNATIVE
routes.description: Climb Auntyclimbx as far as the large tree. Traverse onto tree then traverse left again on small exposed holds and go for the small branch sticking out of large crack at the top of Third Force, continue through trees to top. routes.name: GUNGE
routes.description: 30 m right of Task Force, at an obvious stepped diagonal line leading rightwards. Start about 2m right of 'Arête' in a little corner. Move up and rightwards to a steep section below a block. Pull up and continue up the little rock steps. Move left and up past tree at the top. Good climbing.

routes.name: FANDANGO
routes.description: Takes the obvious offwidth crack on the left of the Aiguille. BLACK RHUMBA 44m E2 5c, 4c 1) 24m Bridge and jam corner to big overhang. Use ivy to move right to small ledge. Climb crack to second overhang. Undercut hand-jam to reach finger-jam on right above and gain off-width for one move (crux). Hand-jam crack until angle eases. Belay on grass ledge below second offwidth. 2) 20m Climb off-width to chockstone. Move left onto wall and gain a tree. Climb chimney to top. THE LONGEST DAY 44m E2 5b, 5b Start just to the right of an area of huge hanging curtains of ivy below a clean wide crack. 1) Climb the crack which is hard at the start and eases as height is gained. Belay on the sloping ledge. 2) Bridge and jam the steep crack above. ASHTREE WALTZ 45m D Climbs the tree filled gully on the right of the Aiguille. DESCENT ROUTE D Start at right end of meadow at centre of crag. D for first 5m then scramble and walk along ramp to top.

routes.name: BLACK RHUMBA
routes.first_ascent: R.Huddleston, R.Finlay (originally climbed as A2)M. Smith, A. Devlin 18th April 1982
routes.description: 1) 24m Bridge and jam corner to big overhang. Use ivy to move right to small ledge. Climb crack to second overhang. Undercut hand-jam to reach finger-jam on right above and gain off-width for one move (crux). Hand-jam crack until angle eases. Belay on grass ledge below second offwidth. 2) 20m Climb off-width to chockstone. Move left onto wall and gain a tree. Climb chimney to top. THE LONGEST DAY 44m E2 5b, 5b Start just to the right of an area of huge hanging curtains of ivy below a clean wide crack. 1) Climb the crack which is hard at the start and eases as height is gained. Belay on the sloping ledge. 2) Bridge and jam the steep crack above. ASHTREE WALTZ 45m D Climbs the tree filled gully on the right of the Aiguille. DESCENT ROUTE D Start at right end of meadow at centre of crag. D for first 5m then scramble and walk along ramp to top.

routes.name: ASHTREE WALTZ
routes.description: Climbs the tree filled gully on the right of the Aiguille. DESCENT ROUTE D Start at right end of meadow at centre of crag. D for first 5m then scramble and walk along ramp to top.

routes.name: DESCENT ROUTE
routes.description: Start at right end of meadow at centre of crag. D for first 5m then scramble and walk along ramp to top.

routes.name: Start at right end of meadow at centre of crag.
MACHINE NUT CRACK
routes.description: 1) 40m Starting on the left side move up and right, through the main overhangs and strenuously up the crag above. The rock deteriorates as grade eases to a good belay ledge on the left. 2) 37m The chimney crack above is climbed, on rock to start, gradually degenerating into steep grass. If the grass is wet this section will probably be the crux and it may be wise to leave a rope hanging from the top. Belay stake in place in a slight dip beyond rock at top of crag. LAXATIVE GULLY VS Start right of centre of crag. 1) Up grass and rock to gully 2) Up gully to top then chimney up. Up left hand wall to top. Dicult rock is very good. The following two routes have also been recorded on the crag, where I do not know! The available descriptions are enclosed for completeness. ROOKERY NOOK 30m S Start 1/4 mile to the left of a quarry at the top edge of a huge cave formed by a fallen slab. 1) 6m. Walk up gully. 2) 24m. Up to chockstone then on up. Exit is dodgy on wall. CHIMNEY ROUTE Chimney up behind huge flake to chockstone. Continue up main face to exit on loose pebbly rock. This massive limestone crag sports but two new routes in its entire length- and finding them isn't easy. But the incentive to climb, or at least look at,Ireland's only (at one time) bolted sports climbs, complete with French grades, may be just enough to keep you searching through the under-growth. Walk along the road on top of the crag (which starts at the far right-hand end) for about 15 minutes until some trees start to appear - as if by magic - on your left. Keep your eyes peeled for a belay stake near the fence and an ash tree with a piece of tat on it. Congratulations. You are now above The Epic McClintock! Alternatively, do what everyone does. Walk along the base of the crag, to the primordial forest on the left and thrash your way through for several minutes until you see the bolts on a buttress up to your right. THE EPIC MCCLINTOCK Fr7a+ E5 6a/b A. Millar & N. Grimes October '91 Basically abseil down the route (or scramble a gully 100m to the right from the top) and climb back up the wall following (and resting on) the bolts. Repeat this until you '...have the power to string all the moves together PADDY ON SITE E1 5c N Grimes, A. Millar '90 A route of more historical than aesthetical value, it was the first bolted route put up here - laying the foundation for future generations of sports climbers. About 100m deeper into the land that time forgot, (or to the right if you're on the top), there's the easy descent gully/ramp.PADDY goes past the first three bolts here and lowers off the fourth. Behind the main cliff, a concrete farm road leads through a rocky valley. On the left side of the road behind a low band of cliffs there rises a steep compact limestone crag about 20 metres high, broken and less steep on the left. About a third of the way in from the left start at a clean section with a groove just left of a bush on the cliff. JALLA SAID CALL IT THE FIELD 15m E2 5c Climb the groove on clean rock trending left then right.

routes.name: JALLA SAID CALL IT THE FIELD
routes.description: Climb the groove on clean rock trending left then right.

routes.name: REVIVAL
routes.description: Start about 2 metres in from the left edge of the crag. Climb clean rock on the left edge of the wall through a niche and then a thin finger crack to the bushes above.

routes.name: PADDY'S SWING
routes.description: This route starts up the wide crack and ramp on the left hand side of the cliff. From the top of the crack make an awkward move right to a ledge. Climb directly to the top. 3.(1) MORIARTY 15m S 4a One metre right of Paddy's Swing.Climb the corner formed by the block. From the top of the block move left using a large pocket to the ledge on Paddy's Swing. Finish as for that route. 3.(2) KEVIN'S ROUTE 20m VS 4c Start on the right side of the huge flake between Moriarty and Mike's Route. Gain the top of the flake. Step out right on steep wall and gain crack then ledge above. Follow a deep crack on the left to the top of the pinnacle. Step across and climb a short wall behind. Belay in trees.

routes.name: (1) MORIARTY
routes.description: One metre right of Paddy's Swing.Climb the corner formed by the block. From the top of the block move left using a large pocket to the ledge on Paddy's Swing. Finish as for that route. 3.(2) KEVIN'S ROUTE 20m VS 4c Start on the right side of the huge flake between Moriarty and Mike's Route. Gain the top of the flake. Step out right on steep wall and gain crack then ledge above. Follow a deep crack on the left to the top of the pinnacle. Step across and climb a short wall behind. Belay in trees.

routes.name: (2) KEVIN'S ROUTE
routes.description: Start on the right side of the huge flake between Moriarty and Mike's Route. Gain the top of the flake. Step out right on steep wall and gain crack then ledge above. Follow a deep crack on the left to the top of the pinnacle. Step across and climb a short wall behind. Belay in trees.

routes.name: MIKE'S ROUTE
routes.description: Start in the corner to the right of the huge flake at the foot of the Left Wall. Surmount the overhang and gain the stump. Continue up to the top of the pinnacle on the left. Move out right on to the wall and climb the wide crack to the tree.

routes.name: ELIMINATION
routes.description: Start to the right of Mike's Route below a small cave at 3m. Move up into the cave (difficult). Traverse rightwards from the cave to reach a ledge. From here climb diagonally leftwards across the face to the top of the block on Mike's Route. Move right and climb the wide crack as for Mike's Route. PERCENTAGE 8m E2 6a Start to the right of Elimination. Move up the crack (6 pegs and a bong were originally used) to a large ledge, then finish Elizabethan, Elimination or Spider. It may be much more difficult now as the ground beneath it was washed away by flood water.

routes.name: PERCENTAGE
routes.description: Start to the right of Elimination. Move up the crack (6 pegs and a bong were originally used) to a large ledge, then finish Elizabethan, Elimination or Spider. It may be much more difficult now as the ground beneath it was washed away by flood water.

routes.name: SPIDER
routes.description: Start below the cave 2 metres right of Mike's Route. Gain the cave by a thin move. Traverse right to a sapling and up left to a good ledge. Move up and right to below the small overhang. Semi layback to gain a horizontal crack and traverse right with difficulty to the arête. Up this to finish. Alternatively, climb directly to the top, which is harder. SCORPION 22m VS 4c Climbs the arête right of Spider. Start as for Elizabethan.Climb the Short Wall to gain a grass ledge. Step up right to a small corner and crack. Climb this and move steeply right into a deep crack/chimney. Climb this to two old trees, one above the other. Struggle through these to a small niche below the final steep crack (the sting in the tail). Layaway up the crack and pull across right to arête. Climb this steeply to the top. ELIZABETHAN 18m HS 4b Start near the right hand edge of the face near the gully. Avoiding the earth and ivy roots move up and to the left (nut runner) until it is possible to gain the large ledge in the middle of the face. From the ledge move up and then left to join the final part of Mike's Route. HANGING TREE WALL 30m A2 Start right of Elizabethan. A direct line to the tree, 24 pegs. Increasing difficulty above the tree on loose rock.

routes.name: SCORPION
routes.description: Climbs the arête right of Spider. Start as for Elizabethan.Climb the Short Wall to gain a grass ledge. Step up right to a small corner and crack. Climb this and move steeply right into a deep crack/chimney. Climb this to two old trees, one above the other. Struggle through these to a small niche below the final steep crack (the sting in the tail). Layaway up the crack and pull across right to arête. Climb this steeply to the top. ELIZABETHAN 18m HS 4b Start near the right hand edge of the face near the gully. Avoiding the earth and ivy roots move up and to the left (nut runner) until it is possible to gain the large ledge in the middle of the face. From the ledge move up and then left to join the final part of Mike's Route. HANGING TREE WALL 30m A2 Start right of Elizabethan. A direct line to the tree, 24 pegs. Increasing difficulty above the tree on loose rock.

routes.name: ELIZABETHAN
routes.description: Start near the right hand edge of the face near the gully. Avoiding the earth and ivy roots move up and to the left (nut runner) until it is possible to gain the large ledge in the middle of the face. From the ledge move up and then left to join the final part of Mike's Route. HANGING TREE WALL 30m A2 Start right of Elizabethan. A direct line to the tree, 24 pegs. Increasing difficulty above the tree on loose rock.

routes.name: ZOOLOGICAL GARDENS
routes.description: A vague route up the gully.

routes.name: ILLOGICAL OOZE
routes.first_ascent: This was a cleaned version of Zoological Gardens but has since reverted to it's original condition. (Cleaned again - 2009)
routes.description: P.Hall APPAULING 23m E1 5b This route follows the fluted arête formed by the gully of Illogical Ooze and the large bulging wall to the right. Steep moves lead to a finger crack from where a long reach gains better holds on the right. Continue up more easily to finish through the jungle above. HOWARD'S ROUTE 23m E3/4 6a Start just right of the gully at a short hand crack. Climb the steep crack to reach flake holds. Climb steeply rightwards to reach jugs in the large pocket/hole (crux). Climb directly up the wall above past an old in-situ thread and a short white groove. Finish through the vegetation above. HOWARD'S OTHER ROUTE 23m E5 6a Just to the right of Howard's Route, up a groove past an in-situ peg. Joins The Bounder and finishes as for this route. HOWARD'S THIRD ROUTE 25m E5 6a In the middle of the wall below the long slot on The Bounder traverse.Climb steeply up the wall and finish as for The Bounder. THE BOUNDER 40m E4 6a 1) Follow Monastir Direct to the cave belay at 14 metres. 2) from the belay traverse left for 5m past a good thread to a hard move into a niche with a knee jam rest. Straight up past layaway flake (good nuts) to good jug. Up on finger pocket (crux) to finger jam on the right. Move left to good jug under peg. Make hard move up and left to reach peg. Make a hard move past the peg and right. Make a hard move up the groove and continue more easily to the top. MONASTIR DIRECT 33m HVS 5a Start at the base of the corner rising from the river bed. 1) 14m Bridge up the cave mouth to gain the crack. Strenuous climbing leads to a ledge on the left. Good thread belay just inside the cave (for those with night vision the cave provides an interesting escape!) 2) 19m Follow the wide crack above by bridging to the top of the flake (sparse protection). Continue up the crack above. Belay a long way back. EXPOSE 30m HVS 5a, 4c 1) Climb the first pitch of Monastir Direct to the cave belay. 2) Step down and traverse right on good holds to the bottom of the flake crack. Climb the crack to where the corner steepens. Reach a hidden crack on the right and pull on to a good ledge on the right wall of the corner. Follow the crack and regain the corner near the top. EXPOSE DIRECT START 30m E3 6a This route takes the steep shallow groove and crack just right of the first pitch of Monastir Direct.Climb direct to join the traverse line of Expose level with the cave belay. RIGHTS OF PASSAGE 30m E3 6a Climb Expose Direct Start to where it joins Expose. Climb diagonally rightwards with difficult moves through the overhang. Climb directly up the wall above to finish. ME 36m E2 5b Start in the middle of the wall 10m right of Monastir Direct.Climb the hand jam crack to an arm thread, Hand traverse right to the arête. Up the thin wall to a stance under an overhang. Climb the overhang directly to big jugs and a ledge. Step left and climb the wall to the top. BLACK BASTARD 27m VS 4c Start 20 metres right of Monastir Direct, and 10m right of Me up the river bank, below a cave.Traverse left and up into the cave. Move out left of cave and surmount overhang moving right. Climb the obvious corner above. THE FILTH 30m E1 5b Start at the cave and old tree stump as for Black Bastard.Traverse diagonally right, passing a small overhang on it's right side, to gain a small ledge. From the ledge move straight up then right to a second ledge with an old tree stump. Move a few feet right along the ledge and climb up using a good pocket hold to a thin crack (micro-rocks). From this point move out left on delicate holds and then straight up to tree stump (crux). Pass the small curving overhang above on it's left side using a series of ledges. Trend right towards the top. Passing a small bush on it's right side. THE FEDS 22m E2 5b Start - about 12m right of the cave mentioned in Black Bastard description there is a large triangular-shaped overhang protruding from the rock face. The Feds follows the steep wall and leftward-trending crack just right of the overhang. Start climbing on the steep wall directly below the bottom of the leftward-trending crack. Use a small right-facing corner to gain a ledge on the left. Climb up trending slightly right to a sloping ledge. From the ledge move left to the diagonal crack leading through overhangs. Continue up the crack until it is possible to step left onto a ledge. From here climb straight up and right to finish. A strenuous route. Protection just adequate. JUNGLE BUNNY 10m HVS 5b Route takes the wall 1m left of Keyhole Crack. Climb the wall until possible to reach obvious crack. Move up to a good rest. Continue more easily to the top. KEYHOLE CRACK 9m S 4a Start at the left hand end (upstream end) of the cliff. Move up the obvious wide crack at the left side of the compact wall. Awkward to start. WET DREAM 9m E1 5b Start below the bulge between Keyhole Crack and Brothers In Arms.Straight up to a small spike and sapling (tape runner). Diagonally left to a corner. Up to the top. BROTHERS IN ARMS 12m E3 6a Start 1m right of Wet Dream.Climb up a shallow overhanging groove to reach a finger slot (crux- no protection). Pull up and right on to a block. Continue diagonally right to a small tree stump. Finish up a groove. STRUGG 12m S 4a Start 12m right of Brothers In Arms on the upstream cliff at a well trodden down tree.Follow the line of holds diagonally right, then a difficult move on to the big ledge. Layback up the flake to a tree, then step onto the wall behind this and up a series of jugs to the top. A bit obscure! GOOD SPORT 12m Fr6c+ The line of three bolts in the centre of the compact wall.Fingery and technical to the first bolt. Hard moves past bolt to good holds. Easier above. VIRGIN RURP 12m E2 5b Start in the middle of the upstream cliff (but on the right hand edge of the cleaner half of the cliff) about 6m left of a large ivy growth and 1 m left of a bulging overhang.Move up a thin crack until possible to step left beneath the brown overhang. Pull over overhang and continue to the top. WHITE OUT 20m HVS 5b Start just left of the arête immediately left of Paddy's Route. Climb the wall to a short crack, gain a good hold and move onto the wall right of the arête. Climb this until possible to traverse left to a ledge and climb overhanging arête to the top. PADDY'S ROUTE 20m S 3c Further right - obvious line at south end of crag.Start on the right and swing left to join right slanting crack. Climb this to strange tube in overhang. Step onto right wall, pull up and continue easily to the top. BLUE MOON 12m D Start in groove below small cave 2m left of Paddy's Route. Climb groove to large platform below overhang. Move left across chimney and finish via yew tree. JUST JUICE 20m VS 4c Start 7m left of Blue Moon where twin grooves form a pillar. Climb left groove for 2m, then move around pillar to right groove and continue up this to top. SNAKE JUICE 23m HVS 5b Start at a large bowl forming overhang 17 m left of Just Juice. Climb corner to a large thread. Awkward move past thread to top of crack. Climb wall above using holds on the left (crux). Belay at tree and walk right along the ledge to the top. CAVERNS ABOVE 24m VD At the downstream end of the lower gorge there is a stream issuing from a large hole. Climb the chimney above to a large ledge. Cross this to a small hole in the wall above. Go through and bridge easily up the chasm beyond. Very unusual route. SLIDE SHOW 10m E1 5b At the right-hand end of the crag there is an overhanging white wall. Start at a line of pockets 1m in from the right edge. Climb the pockets and make a difficult reach to a good hold. Continue to a large spike on the left. Step right and continue to the top. 400px|REVIVAL & PADDY'S SWING REVIVAL & PADDY'S SWING 400px|PADDY'S SWING - MIKE'S ROUTE PADDY'S SWING - MIKE'S ROUTE 400px|MIKE'S ROUTE - ILLOGICAL OOZE MIKE'S ROUTE - ILLOGICAL OOZE 400px|ZOOLOGICAL GARDENS/ILLOGICAL OOZE Gully ZOOLOGICAL GARDENS/ILLOGICAL OOZE Gully 400px|APPAULING - MONASTIR DIRECT MONASTIR DIRECT 400px|MONASTIR DIRECT - Left-handside of the large flake in the middle of the picture. routes.name: APPAULING
routes.description: This route follows the fluted arête formed by the gully of Illogical Ooze and the large bulging wall to the right. Steep moves lead to a finger crack from where a long reach gains better holds on the right. Continue up more easily to finish through the jungle above. HOWARD'S ROUTE 23m E3/4 6a Start just right of the gully at a short hand crack. Climb the steep crack to reach flake holds. Climb steeply rightwards to reach jugs in the large pocket/hole (crux). Climb directly up the wall above past an old in-situ thread and a short white groove. Finish through the vegetation above. HOWARD'S OTHER ROUTE 23m E5 6a Just to the right of Howard's Route, up a groove past an in-situ peg. Joins The Bounder and finishes as for this route. HOWARD'S THIRD ROUTE 25m E5 6a In the middle of the wall below the long slot on The Bounder traverse.Climb steeply up the wall and finish as for The Bounder. THE BOUNDER 40m E4 6a 1) Follow Monastir Direct to the cave belay at 14 metres. 2) from the belay traverse left for 5m past a good thread to a hard move into a niche with a knee jam rest. Straight up past layaway flake (good nuts) to good jug. Up on finger pocket (crux) to finger jam on the right. Move left to good jug under peg. Make hard move up and left to reach peg. Make a hard move past the peg and right. Make a hard move up the groove and continue more easily to the top. MONASTIR DIRECT 33m HVS 5a Start at the base of the corner rising from the river bed. 1) 14m Bridge up the cave mouth to gain the crack. Strenuous climbing leads to a ledge on the left. Good thread belay just inside the cave (for those with night vision the cave provides an interesting escape!) 2) 19m Follow the wide crack above by bridging to the top of the flake (sparse protection). Continue up the crack above. Belay a long way back. EXPOSE 30m HVS 5a, 4c 1) Climb the first pitch of Monastir Direct to the cave belay. 2) Step down and traverse right on good holds to the bottom of the flake crack. Climb the crack to where the corner steepens. Reach a hidden crack on the right and pull on to a good ledge on the right wall of the corner. Follow the crack and regain the corner near the top. EXPOSE DIRECT START 30m E3 6a This route takes the steep shallow groove and crack just right of the first pitch of Monastir Direct.Climb direct to join the traverse line of Expose level with the cave belay. RIGHTS OF PASSAGE 30m E3 6a Climb Expose Direct Start to where it joins Expose. Climb diagonally rightwards with difficult moves through the overhang. Climb directly up the wall above to finish. ME 36m E2 5b Start in the middle of the wall 10m right of Monastir Direct.Climb the hand jam crack to an arm thread, Hand traverse right to the arête. Up the thin wall to a stance under an overhang. Climb the overhang directly to big jugs and a ledge. Step left and climb the wall to the top. BLACK BASTARD 27m VS 4c Start 20 metres right of Monastir Direct, and 10m right of Me up the river bank, below a cave.Traverse left and up into the cave. Move out left of cave and surmount overhang moving right. Climb the obvious corner above. THE FILTH 30m E1 5b Start at the cave and old tree stump as for Black Bastard.Traverse diagonally right, passing a small overhang on it's right side, to gain a small ledge. From the ledge move straight up then right to a second ledge with an old tree stump. Move a few feet right along the ledge and climb up using a good pocket hold to a thin crack (micro-rocks). From this point move out left on delicate holds and then straight up to tree stump (crux). Pass the small curving overhang above on it's left side using a series of ledges. Trend right towards the top. Passing a small bush on it's right side. THE FEDS 22m E2 5b Start - about 12m right of the cave mentioned in Black Bastard description there is a large triangular-shaped overhang protruding from the rock face. The Feds follows the steep wall and leftward-trending crack just right of the overhang. Start climbing on the steep wall directly below the bottom of the leftward-trending crack. Use a small right-facing corner to gain a ledge on the left. Climb up trending slightly right to a sloping ledge. From the ledge move left to the diagonal crack leading through overhangs. Continue up the crack until it is possible to step left onto a ledge. From here climb straight up and right to finish. A strenuous route. Protection just adequate. JUNGLE BUNNY 10m HVS 5b Route takes the wall 1m left of Keyhole Crack. Climb the wall until possible to reach obvious crack. Move up to a good rest. Continue more easily to the top. KEYHOLE CRACK 9m S 4a Start at the left hand end (upstream end) of the cliff. Move up the obvious wide crack at the left side of the compact wall. Awkward to start. WET DREAM 9m E1 5b Start below the bulge between Keyhole Crack and Brothers In Arms.Straight up to a small spike and sapling (tape runner). Diagonally left to a corner. Up to the top. BROTHERS IN ARMS 12m E3 6a Start 1m right of Wet Dream.Climb up a shallow overhanging groove to reach a finger slot (crux- no protection). Pull up and right on to a block. Continue diagonally right to a small tree stump. Finish up a groove. STRUGG 12m S 4a Start 12m right of Brothers In Arms on the upstream cliff at a well trodden down tree.Follow the line of holds diagonally right, then a difficult move on to the big ledge. Layback up the flake to a tree, then step onto the wall behind this and up a series of jugs to the top. A bit obscure! GOOD SPORT 12m Fr6c+ The line of three bolts in the centre of the compact wall.Fingery and technical to the first bolt. Hard moves past bolt to good holds. Easier above. VIRGIN RURP 12m E2 5b Start in the middle of the upstream cliff (but on the right hand edge of the cleaner half of the cliff) about 6m left of a large ivy growth and 1 m left of a bulging overhang.Move up a thin crack until possible to step left beneath the brown overhang. Pull over overhang and continue to the top. WHITE OUT 20m HVS 5b Start just left of the arête immediately left of Paddy's Route. Climb the wall to a short crack, gain a good hold and move onto the wall right of the arête. Climb this until possible to traverse left to a ledge and climb overhanging arête to the top. PADDY'S ROUTE 20m S 3c Further right - obvious line at south end of crag.Start on the right and swing left to join right slanting crack. Climb this to strange tube in overhang. Step onto right wall, pull up and continue easily to the top. BLUE MOON 12m D Start in groove below small cave 2m left of Paddy's Route. Climb groove to large platform below overhang. Move left across chimney and finish via yew tree. JUST JUICE 20m VS 4c Start 7m left of Blue Moon where twin grooves form a pillar. Climb left groove for 2m, then move around pillar to right groove and continue up this to top. SNAKE JUICE 23m HVS 5b Start at a large bowl forming overhang 17 m left of Just Juice. Climb corner to a large thread. Awkward move past thread to top of crack. Climb wall above using holds on the left (crux). Belay at tree and walk right along the ledge to the top. CAVERNS ABOVE 24m VD At the downstream end of the lower gorge there is a stream issuing from a large hole. Climb the chimney above to a large ledge. Cross this to a small hole in the wall above. Go through and bridge easily up the chasm beyond. Very unusual route. SLIDE SHOW 10m E1 5b At the right-hand end of the crag there is an overhanging white wall. Start at a line of pockets 1m in from the right edge. Climb the pockets and make a difficult reach to a good hold. Continue to a large spike on the left. Step right and continue to the top. 400px|REVIVAL & PADDY'S SWING REVIVAL & PADDY'S SWING 400px|PADDY'S SWING - MIKE'S ROUTE PADDY'S SWING - MIKE'S ROUTE 400px|MIKE'S ROUTE - ILLOGICAL OOZE MIKE'S ROUTE - ILLOGICAL OOZE 400px|ZOOLOGICAL GARDENS/ILLOGICAL OOZE Gully ZOOLOGICAL GARDENS/ILLOGICAL OOZE Gully 400px|APPAULING - MONASTIR DIRECT MONASTIR DIRECT 400px|MONASTIR DIRECT - Left-handside of the large flake in the middle of the picture. From this point move out left on delicate holds and then straight up to tree stump (crux). Pass the small curving overhang above on it's left side using a series of ledges. Trend right towards the top. Passing a small bush on it's right side. THE FEDS 22m E2 5b Start - about 12m right of the cave mentioned in Black Bastard description there is a large triangular-shaped overhang protruding from the rock face. JUNGLE BUNNY 10m HVS 5b Route takes the wall 1m left of Keyhole Crack. Climb the wall until possible to reach obvious crack. Move up to a good rest. Continue more easily to the top. KEYHOLE CRACK 9m S 4a Start at the left hand end (upstream end) of the cliff. Move up the obvious wide crack at the left side of the compact wall. Awkward to start. WET DREAM 9m E1 5b Start below the bulge between Keyhole Crack and Brothers In Arms.Straight up to a small spike and sapling (tape runner). Diagonally left to a corner. Up to the top. BROTHERS IN ARMS 12m E3 6a Start 1m right of Wet Dream.Climb up a shallow overhanging groove to reach a finger slot (crux- no protection). Pull up and right on to a block. STRUGG 12m S 4a Start 12m right of Brothers In Arms on the upstream cliff at a well trodden down tree.Follow the line of holds diagonally right, then a difficult move on to the big ledge. VIRGIN RURP 12m E2 5b Start in the middle of the upstream cliff (but on the right hand edge of the cleaner half of the cliff) about 6m left of a large ivy growth and 1 m left of a bulging overhang.Move up a thin crack until possible to step left beneath the brown overhang. BROTHERS IN ARMS 12m E3 6a Start 1m right of Wet Dream.Climb up a shallow overhanging groove to reach a finger slot (crux- no protection). Pull up and right on to a block. Continue diagonally right to a small tree stump. Finish up a groove. STRUGG 12m S 4a Start 12m right of Brothers In Arms on the upstream cliff at a well trodden down tree.Follow the line of holds diagonally right, then a difficult move on to the big ledge. Layback up the flake to a tree, then step onto the wall behind this and up a series of jugs to the top. A bit obscure! GOOD SPORT 12m Fr6c+ The line of three bolts in the centre of the compact wall.Fingery and technical to the first bolt. Hard moves past bolt to good holds. Easier above. VIRGIN RURP 12m E2 5b Start in the middle of the upstream cliff (but on the right hand edge of the cleaner half of the cliff) about 6m left of a large ivy growth and 1 m left of a bulging overhang.Move up a thin crack until possible to step left beneath the brown overhang. Pull over overhang and continue to the top. WHITE OUT 20m HVS 5b Start just left of the arête immediately left of Paddy's Route. Climb the wall to a short crack, gain a good hold and move onto the wall right of the arête. Climb this until possible to traverse left to a ledge and climb overhanging arête to the top. PADDY'S ROUTE 20m S 3c Further right - obvious line at south end of crag.Start on the right and swing left to join right slanting crack. Climb this to strange tube in overhang. Step onto right wall, pull up and continue easily to the top. BLUE MOON 12m D Start in groove below small cave 2m left of Paddy's Route. Climb groove to large platform below overhang. Move left across chimney and finish via yew tree. JUST JUICE 20m VS 4c Start 7m left of Blue Moon where twin grooves form a pillar. Climb left groove for 2m, then move around pillar to right groove and continue up this to top. SNAKE JUICE 23m HVS 5b Start at a large bowl forming overhang 17 m left of Just Juice. CAVERNS ABOVE 24m VD At the downstream end of the lower gorge there is a stream issuing from a large hole. Climb the chimney above to a large ledge. Cross this to a small hole in the wall above. routes.name: SNAKE JUICE
routes.description: Start at a large bowl forming overhang 17 m left of Just Juice. Climb corner to a large thread. Awkward move past thread to top of crack. Climb wall above using holds on the left (crux). Belay at tree and walk right along the ledge to the top. CAVERNS ABOVE 24m VD At the downstream end of the lower gorge there is a stream issuing from a large hole. Climb the chimney above to a large ledge. Cross this to a small hole in the wall above. Go through and bridge easily up the chasm beyond. Very unusual route. SLIDE SHOW 10m E1 5b At the right-hand end of the crag there is an overhanging white wall. routes.name: SNAIL SHELL SLAB
routes.description: Start just left of Crack N'Arête. Climb the short slab on delightful holds. At the top step right and surmount the steep little wall.

routes.name: CRACK N'ARÊTE
routes.description: Start on the left-hand side of Nursery Buttress. Climb the wide crack and stay on the edge above.

routes.name: QUANGO'S TANGO
routes.description: The awkward crack a few feet left.

routes.name: BLOCK ARÊTE
routes.description: The next arête left. Start low down at Base Camp. Reach the leaning block and surmount the bulge above.

routes.name: SKREEN ROCK ARÊTE
routes.description: An obvious sharp arête on the extreme right of this small crag.

routes.name: LUCKY BOUNCE
routes.description: 2 metres left of 'Nightmare...climb clean(!) rock over initial bulge to horizontal break at two thirds height. Finish rightwards on loosish arête.

routes.name: NIGHTMARE OF DRY SPAGNUM
routes.description: Start a few metres left of Misconception. Use the wide crack and bridging moves to reach good holds further up.

routes.name: THUNDER & LIGHTNING
routes.description: A few feet left of Misconception at the base of two thin cracks. Climb these, difficult to start. Well protected with small wires

routes.name: MISCONCEPTION
routes.description: Climb the corner at the left-hand side of the crag.

routes.name: NUMB NUMB
routes.description: Start 4 m left of Footless Duck.Climb the deep crack to where it splits. Gain a ledge and beware of loose rock.

routes.name: FOOTLESS DUCK
routes.description: Climb the first corner on Ashtree Buttress.

routes.name: FRESH START
routes.description: On the wall just right of Footless Duck is a steep thin crack. This route follows the crack direct. Strenuous.

routes.name: FORGOTTEN ROUTE
routes.description: Start immediately left of Technical Advice at an overhang. After a dramatic start climb directly up to finish on loose rock.

routes.name: TECHNICAL ADVICE
routes.description: Climb the cliff 1 m left of Thief's Flight.

routes.name: THIEF'S FLIGHT
routes.description: Climb the front of pinnacle at obvious crack 1 m left of Pillar Arête.

routes.name: PILLAR ARÊTE
routes.description: Climb the cliff 1 m left of Ashtree Catcher.

routes.name: JARGONISTIC
routes.description: Start between Pillar Arête and Ashtree Catcher. A contrived route up the face of the blocks avoiding two other routes.

routes.name: ASHTREE CATCHER
routes.description: R.Henshaw Start - 10 m left of Clarke's Lark at a crack and a large detached block. Climb the awkward corner crack and chimney up behind the block.

routes.name: LIP BASHER
routes.description: Climb the obvious line with bulge at half height. Protection difficult to arrange.

routes.name: FLAKE OUT
routes.description: Start just left of Skreen Sheugh in the corner below flakes. Climb on small holds and 'glued' flakes.

routes.name: SKREEN SHEUGH
routes.description: Start just around the corner from Clarke's Lark. Climb the wide obvious crack and exit up a corner with an ivy stem.

routes.name: CLARKE'S LARK
routes.description: J.Clarke Takes the slab just left of Voie Du Trou. Climb directly on delightful holds to a small pinnacle (loose). Surmount the block directly and exit as for Voie Du Trou.

routes.name: VOIE DU TROU
routes.description: Climb the vegetated corner left of Midge and up behind a jammed boulder. Exit right (loose).

routes.name: MIDGE
routes.description: Climb the next crack left of Finger Me Baby.

routes.name: FINGER ME BABY
routes.description: Climb the next crack left of Bat Roost. Keep strictly to the crack.

routes.name: BAT ROOST
routes.description: Climb the next crack left of Venetian Blind to the top.

routes.name: VENETIAN BLIND
routes.description: Climb the wide crack in the corner left of The Nose.

routes.name: THE NOSE
routes.description: Start 1m left of Rubbly Gubbly Gully. Keep to the steep stepped buttress.

routes.name: RUBBLY GUBBLY GULLY
routes.description: The obvious wide crack leading to a small rubbly chimney.

routes.name: THIN ARÊTE
routes.description: Start 3m left of Condor Moment. Without using holds on climbs either side ascend the arête on small holds.

routes.name: CONDOR MOMENT
routes.description: Start 1 m left of Frog Leap Crack. Climb the wall on small holds to the crack at half height and on to the top.

routes.name: FROG LEAP CRACK
routes.description: Start at the extreme right of the crag. Climb the obvious crack with the jammed spike. 800px 800px 800px 800px 800px 800px 800px 800px

routes.name: KESTREL
routes.description: Start at the bottom of the obvious line or make an interesting traverse from the right to join this obvious line about 3m up where there is a stance or a runner on a piton. Move up (loose rocks) until a short wall is encountered. Surmount the wall (crux) and continue to the top. Peg belay necessary. It is probably best to abseil. There are some suitable trees at the top of the crag. Double ropes are required. LEEFA Possibly on the small crag west of Wheathill rock at Leeffa?

routes.name: <small>Route 1 (loose twin)
routes.description: <small>5m.</small> <small>Follows bolted route 1 ,loads of good placements all the wall, nice easy climb.</small> <small>Route 2 (The Sail) 3a (Bolted)</small> <small>5m.  Update Climb InfoSecond route on enternce face of the crag.</small> <small>Just right of route 1,start the route by stepping up unto the ledge an carry on up the straight face , to trad climb ,climb the crack a little to the left.</small> <small>Bolted route</small> <small>Has two bolts at top for anchor or use the same spike as route 1.</small> <small>Short very easy climb with plenty holds.</small> <small>Route 2 (Sailors Brother) M (Trad)</small> <small>5m. Nice easy climb with good gear placements to the bottom, thou less towards the top.</small> <small>follows the bolted route nearly of route 2 itself.</small> <small>Route 2a (The Corner) 4a (Bolted)</small> <small>5m. Next to route 2 on the corner.</small> <small>Start the climb on the small bottom ledge ,up to the two bore holes, moving to the left where you will find a nice hand hold on the corner ,step up and move back to the right ,an climb straight up to the bolted anchors or top out.</small> <small>Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route.</small> <small>There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors.</small> Route 2 b (Thin Line) <small> 5a (Bolted) ***</small> 6m.Start where there is like a ,v, shaped at the bottom ,follow small crack line then step out right on the corner ,move up to the side crack ,climb to the right and up straight face to the anchor bolts or top out. Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route. There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors. Route 3 (Tippy Toe) <small> 5c (Bolted) **</small> 6m. route next to 2b on the rock around the corner from entrance face and just before route 4. Nice climb ,with good small holds ,an enjoyable climb. Start on small ledge, where you can clip the 1st bolt, big hand jug hand to the left, move up to the sideway crack an climb straight to bolt anchor or again top it out. Bolted route Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route. There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors. Route 4 (Cosy) <small>M (Trad) ***</small> Just right of route 3 . 6m.Start below small ledge, and work way up small crack to the top and anchor with two back bolts. Hard start becomes easier. Another short easy climb with plentiful holds. Using same spike as 1st routes ,or combo of the other spikes ,for anchor or belaying. also bolt anchors behind at top for back up. Route 4a (Push Over) <small>3c (Bolted)</small>

routes.name: Route
routes.first_ascent: Some Climbs may have climbed back in the old ages,But all have be cleaned, demossed/grassed etc from 2020.
routes.description: Drive towards the Pollagollam Coolarkan Cave Near Boho. Parking Near the entrance area an a short 30 sec walk leads you into the quarry. Just on the left is the Entrance Rock Which has the easiest routes and most bolted an climbed area. it behoves each new climber to make their own assessment of the soundness of bolts and/or the soundness of previously quarried rock. Straight to the back of the quarry is the back wall area which has the hardiest climbing, yet to be bolted and fully cleaned to date.You can get to the top of climbs if you park on up from the entrance and pass over the fence on the left. A walk though the trees to the left you find the left climbing area ,with more trad routes an some bolted routes, again still to be fully bolted an cleaned to date. Just before the Back Wall Area on the right though the trees is the right wall of the quarry, a little less routes in here, you can reach the top of the routes from up near the cave. Its Possible to abseil the Waterfall entering the cave, plenty tree at the top for anchors, rope protector needed. <big>Entrance Rock</big> <small>Route 1 (The Loose) 2b (Bolted)</small> <small>5m. easy climb.</small> <small>Just as you enter the quarry on left you will see the first two routes,on the left is route 1,large lose boulder in rock,climb up face unto the ledges,anchor of the ring an bolt or top out to use the steel spike.</small> <small>bolted route</small> <small>Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route.</small> <small>There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors.</small> <small>1st route on entrance face</small> <small>Route 1 (loose twin) M (Trad)</small> <small>5m.</small> <small>Follows bolted route 1 ,loads of good placements all the wall, nice easy climb.</small> <small>Route 2 (The Sail) 3a (Bolted)</small> <small>5m.  Update Climb InfoSecond route on enternce face of the crag.</small> <small>Just right of route 1,start the route by stepping up unto the ledge an carry on up the straight face , to trad climb ,climb the crack a little to the left.</small> <small>Bolted route</small> <small>Has two bolts at top for anchor or use the same spike as route 1.</small> <small>Short very easy climb with plenty holds.</small> <small>Route 2 (Sailors Brother) M (Trad)</small> <small>5m. Nice easy climb with good gear placements to the bottom, thou less towards the top.</small> <small>follows the bolted route nearly of route 2 itself.</small> <small>Route 2a (The Corner) 4a (Bolted)</small> <small>5m. Next to route 2 on the corner.</small> <small>Start the climb on the small bottom ledge ,up to the two bore holes, moving to the left where you will find a nice hand hold on the corner ,step up and move back to the right ,an climb straight up to the bolted anchors or top out.</small> <small>Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route.</small> <small>There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors.</small> Route 2 b (Thin Line) <small> 5a (Bolted) ***</small> 6m.Start where there is like a ,v, shaped at the bottom ,follow small crack line then step out right on the corner ,move up to the side crack ,climb to the right and up straight face to the anchor bolts or top out. Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route. There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors. Route 3 (Tippy Toe) <small> 5c (Bolted) **</small> 6m. route next to 2b on the rock around the corner from entrance face and just before route 4. Nice climb ,with good small holds ,an enjoyable climb. Start on small ledge, where you can clip the 1st bolt, big hand jug hand to the left, move up to the sideway crack an climb straight to bolt anchor or again top it out. Bolted route Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route. There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors. Route 4 (Cosy) <small>M (Trad) ***</small> Just right of route 3 . 6m.Start below small ledge, and work way up small crack to the top and anchor with two back bolts. Hard start becomes easier. Another short easy climb with plentiful holds. Using same spike as 1st routes ,or combo of the other spikes ,for anchor or belaying. also bolt anchors behind at top for back up. routes.name: Route 6 (overhang) <small>
routes.description: Next to route 5 Use the anchor bolts/ring of route 5. Spikes at top for belay ,also anchor bolts / ring/s at top of route. Great wee 3 star climb with nice moves. Climb up a little using small crack to right for a foot hold an clip 1st bolt, reach up over the hanging rock to find a nice hand hold where you can pull yourself up and over unto the small ledge an clip 2rd bolt ,climb up to the anchor point of 5 for belay or anchor point There is also bolts on back area for backing up any spike or top anchors. Route 6a (Ray's Jug) <small>M (Trad)</small> 6m.  following the overhang Route 6. (Vandalised route) Cruze line <small>f6A+ <small>(Boulder Circuit)</small></small> <nowiki>*</nowiki>1st boulder climb on this,some boy from Dublin?*
